before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"cp17p","text":"Do not forget to record the metadata for this sample. Before starting, clean MSC Class II with 70% ethanol and make up virkon. Ensure you have all materials needed to carry out the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"81mgj","text":"This protocol outlines the method for the enzymatic dissociation of healthy paediatric skin \u003e3mm into a single cell suspension.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"2hav5","text":"This protocol has been tested on a variety of skin sites such as lip and trunk, however not all body sites has been tested. This protocol has also only been used for healthy, non-diseased skin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: CZI Pediatric Networks for the Human Cell Atlas

groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"9clim","text":"Petri dish","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f795q","text":"Scalpel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8uie","text":"Forceps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87nok","text":"100 micron fiilters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6913b","text":"RPMI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v567","text":"RF-10 (RPMI plus 10%FCS, 1% Pen-strep and 1% L-glut)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2lnh","text":"48-well v bottom plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7obsh","text":"PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61t49","text":"Dispase (Roche)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91cps","text":"Collagenase Type IV (Worthington)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8ivr","text":"50ml Falcon Tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cni3","text":"Flow Buffer (PBS 2% FCS and 2mM EDTA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"26t34","text":"Empty sample onto petri dish and wash sample with PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"anqab","text":"Cut off lower dermis and fat and place in well of 48-well plate with 1ml RPMI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3oc8b","text":"Place epidermis and upper dermis sample in a 48 well V-bottom plate with 1ml RPMI and 20ÂµL Dispase","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9cat","text":"Take plate out of fridge and empty epidermis/upper dermis onto new petri dish, remove collagenase type IV from -80 freezer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fq4qo","text":"Using forceps, separate epidermis and upper dermis and place each separately into new wells of the 48-well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5tb2t","text":"Place 1ml RPMI in each well of plate containing epidermis and upper dermis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7q11d","text":"Add collagenase type IV  1:100 (10ÂµL) to each of the tissues (epidermis, upper dermis and lower dermis)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ah50f","text":"Place in incubator and incubate at 37Â°C for 3 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"akfef","text":"Remove from incubator and, using 1ml pipette, pipette each tissue up and down to ensure the tissue has dissociated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8dku3","text":"Pipette through 100micron filter into separate 50ml Falcon tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8p7m3","text":"Wash out each well an additional 3 times with 1ml RF-10 and pass through filter ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsf26","text":"Wash filter with 25ml RF-10 and adjust so each Falcon tube has the same volume","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvv07","text":"Centrifuge at 500g for 5 mins at 4deg (9acc/dec)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"66o95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F4A72500EBF11EE8BC26D0CFDC4C004","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37k2m","text":"Pour off supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50nb5","text":"Resuspend pellet with 1ml of Flow Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f6v3o","text":"Take 10ÂµL for cell count and count using Trypan Blue and C-Chip Haemocytometer, record number of cells isolated for each tissue","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fjiev","text":"Add parafilm to plate and leave in 4Â°C fridge overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"179v2","text":"Record sample meta data and assess size of sample  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73a30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}}}}

steps.section: Day 1 - Begin protocol late afternoon
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dpkd2","text":"If sample is \u003c3mmx3mm freeze and embed sample in OCT (see other protocol), if sample is \u003e3mmx3mm continue with protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Day 2 - Begin protocol early in the morning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8q5t","text":"If sorting for single cell RNA seq, continue with antibody staining and FACS protocol or if freezing down cells, continue with viable cell freezing protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Single cell dissociation of healthy paediatric skin
title_html: Single cell dissociation of healthy paediatric skin
